stepTitle: Potassium atoms in a flame emit light as they undergo transitions from one energy level to another that is $$4.9\times{10}^{\left(-19\right)}$$ J lower in energy. Calculate the wavelength in nm of the light emitted. $$𝐸=\frac{hc}{\lambda}$$, J $$=$$ $$kg m^2 s^{\left(-2\right)}$$, c $$=$$ $$3\times{10}^8$$ $$\frac{m}{s}$$, $$h$$ $$=$$ $$6.626\times{10}^{\left(-34\right)}$$ $$J s$$
